text: Bottle at Budapest. As Mikkeller Chipotle Porter. Opaque black with brown head. The aroma is smoked with notes of chili, BBQ sauce, vanilla and some roastiness. Bitter flavor, quite hot from the chili, smoked with notes of dark chocolate, roasted malt, BBQ sauce, hot and hoppy finish. Smooth, full-bodied.

Aromat: czekolada, kawa, paloność, mocna nuta ostrej przyprawowości.
Wygląd: czarne, smoliste, wysoka, beżowa czapa piany, utrzymuje się na powierzchni na długo.
Smak: wytrawne, gorzka czekolada, kawa, paloność plus wyraźne papryczki chili. Poza chili sporo goryczy od chmieli i palonych słodów. Ciała całkiem całkiem, finisz pikantny, papryczki palą w usta i przełyk. Bez rewelacji, ale wypić można. Na pewno ciekawe piwo.
Pikantne, ale nie aż tak, żeby przysłonić atrakcje portera - dobry powny eksces dla beer geeków.
Milk chocolate and syrup. The beer begins sweet and is rounded of by a mild roasty bitterness. The heat from the Chipotle comes in the finish, but is a bit on the weak side.
Tap Takeover Mikkeller. Cacao en nariz. En boca ahumados con fondo ligeramente picante. Buen cuerpo y muy equilibrada.

Fajsúlyos stout külső jegyei, éjfekete test, bézs színű, barna beütésű habréteg. Krémes, tejszínes színezetű illatok, szójás, kávés, olvasztott étcsokoládés jegyekkel, izgalmas aromák rétege az ital fölött. Hasonlóan sötét hangulatot árasztó ízjegyei egy közepes testességű ital szerkezetét töltik meg tartalommal, melyben az üres kávé pörkölt karaktere, magas kakaótartalmú étcsokoládé keserédes lenyomata, némi férfias komlózottság, de legfőképpen a simogatóan csipős, sós jelleget kölcsönző paprikás pikantéria megnyilatkozása viszi a prímet. Nem a meglepetés erejével ható főzet, a csípős hozzávaló érvényesülése azonban ez esetben sem hagy kivetnivalót maga után, remekül passzol a sörhöz a Chipotle pajkos karaktere.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
Excellent dark color, the darkest beer Ive ever seen, and very strong taste of, probably, chili pepper. Really dont like it and couldnt even finish these 330ml.

Aroma: Strong chocolate and spices, liquorize.
Appearance: Black color with cloudy liquid and brown head.
Taste: Heavy bitterness with some light sweet and light bitter notes.
Palate: Full body with oily liquid and average carbonation. Long bitter finish with hot spicy touches that remains for a while.
Overall: Curious notes. Very strong flavour and pretty spicy for a beer. After a few sips the tongue gets used to the flavours and it is nice but the aroma is not nice.

Bottle. Pitch black beer, rocky brown head with great duration and lacing. Aroma of chocolate (milk, bitter), some coffee, roasted malts and spices. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter, of chocolate, light notes of coffee, smoke, roasty, chili. Intense burning chili finish. Fairly dense, medium bodied, with soft to average carbonation. Really good and intense beer with strong spice kick. I am still not convinced by chili in beer.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Mleczna, płynna czekolada z chili. Pyszne.
Black with a voluminous mocha head. Aroma is coffee with a hint of spice. Taste is plenty of chili, but not so much as to light your tongue on fire. Lingering warmth.

330ml bottle. As "Chipotle Porter". Pours black with a large, creamy, light brown head, lasting. Roasted malt aroma with dark chocolate, chili pepper, coffee and a hint of smoke. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, smoke and iodine with a dry, mildly bitter, spicy chili pepper finish that leaves a slight burning sensation in your throat. Medium to full-bodied with a sticky, oily texture and soft carbonation.

Pours thick black, with a medium brown head, spotted lacing. Aroma of dark malts, chocolate and chili peppers. Taste feels the same, with lot of chocolate fudge, burning Chipotle chili peppers, roasted malts and mild coffee. Sweet, roasted and spicy hot, full bodied, a joy at every sip. A masterpiece, fantastic ale!

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a glass. Black with dark brown highlights and hot peppers. Aroma is chocolate & hot peppers, medium body, little carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is chocolate and hot peppers.

330ml bottle. As "Chipotle Porter". Pours an opaque black with a large, creamy, long lasting, light brown head that leaves curtains of lace. Roasted malt aroma with dark chocolate, chili pepper, coffee and a hint of smoke. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, smoke and iodine with a dry, mildly bitter, spicy chili pepper finish that leaves a slight burning sensation in your throat. Medium to full body with a sticky, oily texture and soft carbonation. The chili pepper starts off subtle, but the heat grows the deeper you dive into this beer. I thought this beer was excellent and full of flavour, others may be overwhelmed.

Smells tar, hops, malt. Pitch black liquid, dark brown head.Taste is burnt bread, hops, chilly. Long bitter and burnt bread aftertaste. Amount of chilly is decent, doesnt burn much. Rather strange beer, but not bad.
Black pour with brown head. Spicy, chocolate aroma with hints of chipotle. Dark roasted, smoky flavor with hints of chocolate and chipotle with a slight pepper warmth on the palate.

Zelfde label als Texas Ranger, op het label staat chipotle porter. In aroma ruik je reeds de chili. De smaak is een fijne licht rokerige smaak door de chipotle; deze prikkelt ook effectief de achterkant van de tong en de keel. Zeer fijne ervaring. Dit gevoel zet zich door in de afdronk. Lijkt me ideaal met een chili con carne!
Great porter from Mikkeller, with rich dark colour and beautifull head, nics aroma of cacao, coffee, biscuits. Delicius taste with a hint of spicyness

Bottle. As "Chipotle Porter". Pours a very dark brown with medium brown head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is of roasted malt, caramel, and alcohol. Didnt taste the chipotle at first, but then it came to life. Leaves a very spicy note. Interesting and original beer.
Schwarzes Bier mit reichlich dunkelbraunem Schaum. Malzig, Röstaromen, dunkle Bitterschokolade, etwas Kaffee, blumig, leicht scharf, bitter.

14.12.2016 - Well made porter with a nice suitable smoke note and chili. Chili is not that agressive but decent spicey. Taste of roasted malts and some chocolate. Even some coffee. Same in aroma. Suitable name and lable

Bottle (330 ml) at home. As "Mikkeller Chipotle Porter". Dark brown - almost black with a medium brown head, good retention, leaving plenty of lacing. Aroma is a well balanced mix of roasted malts, chili peppers, chocolate and mild fruitiness. Taste is also balanced - though a little less because the chili peppers take more place, but its not overpowering and give a nice little kick - with chocolate, roasted malts, vegetal/green pepper notes but surprisingly it blends well with the profile, mild caramel notes and light fruitiness. Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. A bit oily mouthfeel. Warming but never burning chili peppers finish with lingering but not overpowering roasted and chocolatey notes. With this kind of adjunct Porter, the key is in the balance and its impressively achieved here. I had no problem drinking half of the bottle and I could see myself having this again in the future which - at least for me - tells a lot when the beer is question is a Porter w/ chili peppers. Flavorful and enjoyable.
Dark, dark, black. Dark brown slowly settling foam head, lasting, lacing. Coffee aroma and spiced coffee in taste. A very nice beer. (Velp 201612)

Pours a very dark brown with a brown head that leaves some pretty nice lacing. Nose us immediately recognizable as a Mikkeller stout/porter with that slightly overroasted (but not ashy) malt, chocolate and green hops. Chipotle is definitely there too to spice things up but it is not overpowering at all. Taste is lightly sweet, lightly bitter and the chipotle heat adds a nice touch. More green hops and chocolate. This doesnt destroy your tastebuds at all, really nicely balanced. Body is medium-full, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is smooth and a little sticky. I rarely drink stouts and porters outside of tastings anymore but this one I could see myself drinking again. Nice!

As Chipotle Porter. Pours a really nice pitch black color with medium brown head. Nice retention as well. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, molasses and roasted malts, with a slightly spicy undernote. Medium to full mouthfeel, creamy texture. Taste follows the nose, but this time, the chipotle is more present, but doesnt overwhelm or mask the other flavours. Really nice Porter.

As Chipotle Porter. Pours a pitch black, talking oil black, color, topped with a medium small coffee cream colored head, slowly settling. Medium roasty nose with quite some dark chocolate, a bit woody, which later takes on some stronger coffee notes and some peppery feel that tickles your nose. Taste follows with medium roastiness, a bit of bitterness and decently spicy and hot finish that only intensifies in aftertaste - real chili fest. Thick body, quite full, and all in all very enjoyable.

As Mikkeller Chipotle Porter
Bottle 33cl
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Dark brown.
T: Roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, slightly spicy.

Draught @ Hair of the Dog (Phloen Chit). Opaque dark brown with medium sized tan spongy head, light mocha aroma, medium carbonation, bitter mocha taste with alcohol undertones, hint of chili, thick body, long bitter finish. More stout-like than porter.

Bottle 0.33l at home, Riihimäki (as Mikkeller Chipotle Porter). Colour is dark brown with small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Dark chocolate, chocolate, some coffee, some chipotle and roasted malts.
Probably the best porter I have had below 7%. Viscosity like an imperial stout to begin with. Lush chocolate palate with just a tinge of chili that peers through on the finish.

Tap - aroma is slightly of chipotle. Taste is bitter stout with medium chilli all the way through, and provides the finishing warm feeling filling the mouth and on the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Als Chipotle Porter, met revolver etiket. Aroma is koffie, muffig en wat van gebrand suiker. Smaak is vlak met koffie en hint cacao. Nasmaak behoorlijk scherp wat irritant wordt. Niet geheel een succes. Donkerzwart.

Bottle. Roasted coffee and dark chocolate aroma. Classic dark porter appearance with a thin brown head. Espresso and dark chocolate flavour with some spicey notes. Full bodied with a lot more spice in the finish. Interesting brew.

Közepes, barna, sokáig tartó hab, fekete szín. Csokis, pörkölt malátás illat, pici csípős paprikás aromával. Íze édeskés csokis, pörkölt malátás, paprikás, kissé csípős aromákkal, hosszú lecsengéssel. Közepesen testes és szénsavas, enyhén keserű. Kellemesen megvadított, finom porter.

Fat @ Bishops Arms GAT, Malmö. (Under namnet Chipotle Porter). Svart öl med ett snyggt mörkbeigt skum. Dofter av kaffe, mörk choklad och örter. Smakinslag av kaffe, chilli, rostad malt och mörk choklad. Härlig chilli-hetta i eftersmaken - välavvägd.
Bottle tall boys beer market Leeds. Black great tan head. Dark roast coffee nose. Taste same good smokey chilli.

On tap. Deep brown/black colour with a small beige head. Average retention. Roasted malts, chocolate and chili in the aroma. Average to soft carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter more towards the finish with sour and spicy hot notes. Overall, a very tasteful and complex beer.

- tiefschwarze Farbe mit schöner cremiger Schaumbildung
- wunderbare Noten nach Schokolade und Kaffee
- angenehm ölige Konsistenz in Verbindung mit einer
 optimalen Kohlensäurebeigabe
- geschmacklich stehen dann Frucht, Malz und Hopfenbitternis
 in perfekter Balance
- der Abgang wird dann durch eine leichte Schärfe nochmals
 richtig spannend
Fazit: Ein perfektes Porter, mit einer interessanten Schärfe
Draught at BBB. Pitch black with beige head. Chocolate, Coffee aroma. Same in flavor, The chili floats around in the mouth. Really nice!

750ml bottle under the mikkeller Chipotle Porter lable. Pours out dark brown almost black topped with a small head. Nose is big chilies roast malts coffee chocolate and some wood..taste is more of the peppers chocolate roast and some bitter notes.

Black. Rich malt profile, roasted and caramelly, with notes of chocolate and coffee in the aroma. Moderately sweet taste, with medium bitterness and some sour notes. The chili flavour slowly builds up, turning into a rather hot finish. Full body, with low carbonation. Overall, a very good porter. It is very tasty, and the amount of chipotle is just right.

Mostly a pepper aroma. On the lighter side, and I cant get malt or roastiness. Pours black with a healthy sized tan head. Slight shades of red on the side when held at the light. Very peppery, with some smokiness enmeshed in that. Thats really good. I dont get much of the base beer, though. Not a lot of malt flavor, either sweet or roast. The pepper heat level is in a decent range. Body is on the lighter side. And carbonation level is pretty mellow.

Donker zwart, bruine schuimkraag die blijft, mooie lacing. 
Aroma: Donkere geroosterde mouten, donker fruit, chocolade, koffie, vanille, zoethout
...De chipotle merk ik niet in de aroma.
Smaak: Iets assig, gebrand...., geroosterde mout, vanille, donkere koffie en chocolade. Daarna steken mooi de hopbitter naar voren en achter in je keel en op je tong merk je de chipotle pepers iets branden .... gelukkig niet overdadig. 
Een complexe Porter met veel smaken.
Body is medium, voldoende koolzuur, zacht mondgevoel. 
In de afdronk de pittige chipotle...licht bitter en droog.
Wat een topper!

Present from my nieces. Good choice - Thanks :-) Pours almost black with large beige head with medium retention with some lacing. Aroma of malt, roasted sweetness and chocolate. Pretty much like a good porter making me wonder about the chipotle. First taste is of porter: roasted malt, a little smoke, dark fruit and dark sugar, but then the chipotle creeps in and leaves you with a warm porter/smoky/chilli aftertaste which is very pleasant. Will have more of this come winter if possible....
Pours a black color with a small longlasting tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and chili aroma. Roasted malty spicy chili and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate and chili finish.

330 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, as Mikkeller Chipotle porter. Black color with brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, spicy, vegetables, green beans when its cold, chocolate. Sweet and bitter spicy taste. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation and spicy aftertaste.

Pours a black colour with a big off white head that fades leaving a ring and a good lace. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, chipotle is not present at first but you can notice it later, nuts, smoky, roasted malts. Medium body, carbonation its ok. Taste has chipotle more noticeable than aroma, smoky, coffee, chocolate. Astringent but sweet and smoky.

HOME 20160717 (33 cl bottle, bbf 30.06.19): A very dark brown beer with a brownish head. Aroma of dark roasted malt which gives a nice chocolate smell. For the rest some nuts, dark red fruit, pepper, vanilla. The taste starts with sweetness and bitter chocolate (dark roasted malt). And then a sharp pepper feeling which stays long in the back of the mouth. Besides the spicy taste also some malt bitterness and dark red fruit. In the aftertaste sweet sticky and somewhat bitter dryness. Also some yeast. It could be a nice drinkable beer, but the spicy aftertaste is for me not nice (too sharp).

33cl bottle. Pitch black pour with a tall espresso head, dense, slow to rise to the surface. Hoppy smell, with notes of pine resin, cocoa, chocolate, subtle grape and cherry sourness and paprika. The taste is rich with chocolate, roasted grains, smoke, bell peppers and a bit of licorice. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation and a roasty, chili-hot aftertaste.
How : bottle Appearance : black with a medium tanned head. Aroma : tobacco, coffee, pepper, grass and chocholate. Palate : full body, soft carbonation.

Svart med ett litet skum. Rätt ordinär med ett litet sting av chii på slutet. Helt ok grundöl, men man vill ha mer av allt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from mchughs. Pours deep black with deep tan head. Earth, wood, oak, toast, slight chocolate hints on nose with a smoky tobacco hint. Flavor is a understated sweet, wood dry earth with a massive, throat raking chilling hit. This is just about on good taste side and is balanced fairly well. Spice finish with chocolate aftertaste. The spice hit is something else and by far the spiciest one Ive had. This borders on the indecent.

Pitch black, medium tan creamy head, good lacing and long lasting. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted malt, some dark fruit, bit burnt, moderate chili. Taste is medium sweet malt, lots of dark chocolate and roasted malt, some burnt notes, moderate chili with some acidity, medium bitterness, dry finish, lasting chili spicy aftertaste and burn. Full- bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. Extremely nice!
(on tap, Craft Room, Zagreb)

Aroma - has a nice mix of peppery (spicy) qualities over rich dark smoked malt.
Appearance - body is black, with a big beige head. The head fades slowly, and has a mix of alcohol cloying and sud lacing.
Taste - peppery (spicy), rich roast, annatto, and chocolate.
Palate - body is full, texture thick, average carbonation, and a spicy alcoholic finish.

330 ml bottle. Purchased November 2014. Pours an average size frothy brownish head and has a dark brown appearance with sediments quite visible. Lacing is ok. Aromas of chocolate, hints of coffee and vanilla. Very subtle spice notes. Flavours are mostly roasted malts, some notes of coffee, peppery, subtle mocha hints. The chipotle is sort of evident, a bit more in the finish. Also a bit more as it warms up. Drying sensation on the palate. Quite enjoyable.

Chipotle Porter. On tap at Craft Room. Pitch black body with a brown-grey lasting small head. Chocolate and peppers in the aroma, herbal, nice! Dry chocolate, caramel, strong taste, ashy and miky, milk chocolate, milk caramel and peppers. Damn this is good! Full and heavy, slightly on the cloying side, but not much. Superb beer!

Bottle shared at Richards. Black with dark tan head. Roasted chocolate malts, smoke, smoked and grilled paprika, peppers. Medium sweet, medium spicy (in the beginning -- increasing rapidly), mild chocolate bitter. Medium body, low carbonation. Quite hoppy and chocolatey. The spiciness takes over rapidly but remains at a pleasant level. Nice stuff.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Black with light brown head. Coffee, raw cocoa, roasted barley, light smoke, quite earthy. Light to medium chili burn in the finish. Medium roasted bitter and light sweet. Medium bodied.

Thanks to AleRider78 for sharing this one (as I could not find this one back in late 2014). Dark brown colour with loads of chipotle spices floating all around. Beautiful creamy mocha head with good retention and awesome lacing. Roasted malt aromas with some dark fruity notes and hints of the burnt spices. The roasted malt is quite present in the taste again with some nice bitterness in the end. The chipotle warms the mouth in the aftertaste. Glad I could try this.
Tummaa portteria. Tuoksu melko mieto, vähän savuinen. Maku maltainen, savuinen, makea. Lopuksi chili potkaisee kivasti ja lasillisen jälkeen jo oikein tuntuvasti.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, medium brown head with good retention. Nose is roasted malts with cocoa. Taste is cocoa, roasted malts, light coffee and definitve chili in the aftertaste, but not too harsh, just like a chocolate with chili. Lovely.
Jetblack, red brickish head. Aroma roasty, chocolate notes. Palate thick, creamy, low carbonation. Coffee, roastiness, dark caramel. Very hot finish from the chillies with a hint of smoke. Good.

I cant believe this beer was rated so highly by people. I ordered it because of the ratings. It tastes like liquid smoke. I think it would make a good marinade for chicken, but as a beverage, it was so heavy I found it unbearable and didnt even finish it, despite having paid too much for it. And my burps tasted even worse.
On tap at Chinaski Lavapiés, Madrid. Pours deep black with creamy brown head. Aroma of coffee, toasted malts, molasses. Taste is sweet and spicy, light bitter. Full bodied, soft carbonation.
Bottle from Yeme. Dark brown/black colour. Very nice beige head. Aroma roasted, coffe, chocolate, caramel, some smoke, nuts, hops. Taste is roasted, caramel, earthy hops, chilli. Very good.

Bottle at Mikkeller Tasting, Urban Space. Almost black color, dark beige head. Oily liquid. Aroma is full of roasted malt, cocoa, chocolate, coffee, citrus fruits on background, chilli. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet with chilli finish. Nice

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Bottle as "Mikkeller Chipotle Porter". Pours opaque black with huge thick dark brown head. Aroma is intense hopy with notes of spruce, bitter grapefruit, pomelo but also lots of campfire smoke and beech smoked meat with notes if gravy, beef stock, soy sauce and shrimp paste underneath. Taste is medium sweet, medium to very bitter, faint acidic, medium umami and light salty. Body is creamy with soft carbonation. Finish is very long with notes that follow the nose plus a warm touch of chili and notes of dark chocolate, espresso, mint and yogurt. Rich and perfectly balanced.

Bottle from LCBO. Been in the cellar for a bit, probably more than six months. Lovely smokey aroma with leather, coffee, chocolate, hint of green pepper smell. Pitch black with brown head. Quite dry porter flavour, coffee and chocolate, hint of chipotle.
On tap. @elcoleccionista. Color negro opaco. Espuma marrón muy persistente.cuerpo denso. sabor a café q termina en ligero picante. Picante acumulativo según vas tomando tragos

0,33l bottle. Pours black colour with good amount of head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, licorice. Taste has some spiciness in it with a pretty thick body, some bitterness. Chiliness in the aftertaste.

Strong and persistent aroma of cocoa, spices and burned wood. Really dense, strong taste with some initial sweetness, followed by strong bitterness and spicy finish. Not entirely sure about the finish actually, but bonus points for originality.
cafecito con sorpresa al final, una cerveza que bebida bien atemperada puede ser brutal con ese picor final en la garganta!

Tomada de barril en el Kraken ( Oviedo).

Porter densa, con buen sabor a café, retrogusto picante q se acumula en la garganta.
Para mi gusto escesivo picante.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 Caña 20cl en cervecería Kraken ( Oviedo ) Espuma densa oscura, tono marrón, sabor a café y cacao pero con un toque en el paladar picante, como siempre en este tipo de cervezas el picante "mata" demasiado el sabor del resto

Bottle. Sensoric. Deep brown, with thick, densed, light brown, head. Nice head retention, poor lacing. Aroma is mainly dark fruits (plums in chocolate, raisins), alos some roasted malts - coffee, earthy together with some spicey, peppery notes. Taste is a little bit worse, medium bitter, from semi-sweet to semi-dry in the end. Medium body, nice, thick and oily texture, average carbonation. Finish is semi-dry and bitter. In overall interesting beer with nice complex flavours, the spicey character is not as intense as you could expect.

Dark brown colour. High beige head. Herbal notes, metallic notes, hints of cocoa, hints of spices, hints of smoke in the aroma. Cocoa at first. Hints of bread. Hints of chocolate in the middle. Spicy finish. Chilli in the aftertaste. Quite well balanced, rather medium bodied, thick beer. Quite drinkable and interesting beer.

Bouteille verts de 330 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Légère odeur de café avec une pointe de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun moyen col brun mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales torréfié avec une pointe de caramel et de piment Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de piment en arrière goût. (Rating #6861)

Draft. Pitch black beer with dark beige head. Aroma of coffee, sweet malt, coal, dirt. Taste is filled with coffee and something that I cant describe (tar, motor oil, cigarettes?), I sense some creamy lacto hints. I dont get any chilies in the aroma or the taste. It has, however, a strong taste of metal and paint thinner. Coffee and dark chocolate. A messy beer. Cant understand how people can drink this bomb.

Bottle (labeled Chipotle Porter); pours dark brown with a beige head; aroma of chocolate, licorice, roasted malt, and some spice notes; taste has some light bitterness with roasted malt, chocolate, and licorice with a hint of coffee; finish is dry and bitter with a light spicy warming; nicely balanced and very good

Bottle labelled Chipotle Porter. Dark black great fluffy tan head. Milk chocolate, coffee, vague pepper aroma. Smooth bitter porter with a tinge throughout of peppers. Not entirely chipotle for me, I expected more smoke, rather spicy chili in the background. Silky body quite thick. Leaves a spicy layer in your mouth mixed with roasted malts and dry bitterness. I really like this one a lot. I loved the Mexas ranger, which was a bit more complex, but this one is also a great combo. A thick classic porter with a nice mild spiciness to it.

(backlog, shared at Braukunst Live 2016 - SA.) Exquisitely balanced chipotled porter, combining depth of coffee roast and dessert caramels, great mouthfeel and some of that fresh pepper burn to make a liquid 80% bitter chocolate with red pepper bar, with a side of espresso crema. Notes: - the pepper zing stops just right on the cusp of becoming vegetal, highlighting the caramel roast and ashy coffee notes, deepening and supporting the overall flavour sensation. - As always, impressive hop engineering going on underneath the hood. Memorable without notes.
Bottle. Pours coffee brown color with thick creamy brown head. Strong coffee aroma with roasted malts, caramel and dark chocolate. Lots of chilli spice thats warms throat in pleasent way. Great beer.
Black with a thick brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roast malt, chili, earthy hops. Taste was light sweet with a light bitter finish. Thick oily texture with low carbonation. Really nice beer.

Black color with brown head. Aroma has chocolate, herbs, and roasted malts. Taste is medium sweet and medium-to-heavy bitter. Medium body with oily mouthfeel. Soft carbonation with dry and spicy finish.

Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours black with very dark head, oily texture - looks stunning. Nose is intense roast, chocolate, faint spiciness and chili, coffee. Tastes roasted malts, coffee, burn of chili. One of the better chili beers although still not my style.
Pours a dark black with coffee head. Aroma is chili peppers mixed with roasted coffee. Taste is complex roasted nuts, bitter coffee followed by spicy chipotle. Really enjoyable!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 18/01/20. wysoka ciemna piana, niebrzydka, ciemno brazowe piwo. aromaty glownie czekolada, i to urozmaicona, w sensie a la bombonierka, z marcepanem, karmelem, owocami kandyzowanymi i jakimis innymi tego typu nutami. do tego dochodzi nieco zywicznosci, ciut a la black ipa. w ustach niby jest analogia, ale faktycznie papryczki szybko przejmuja kontrole, w posmakach juz dominujac. niemalo ciala, niewielkie wysycenie, nieco popolowa konsystencja. klasa.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Kolor: Czarny jak dym z rewolwera Strażnika z Texasu.
W żadnym miejscu nie ma jakiegokolwiek prześwitu innego koloru.
Piwo przy nalewaniu jest gęste jak olej silnikowy. 

Piana: Ciemno beżowa, wpadająca w brąz, bardzo gęsta.
Piana złożona jest z małych i średnich pęcherzyków powietrza.
Bardzo dobry lacing z licznymi malunkami na krawędziach kielicha.

Zapach: Zaraz po zrzuceniu kapselka do nozdrzy dostaje się solidna dawka gorzkiej i mlecznej czekolady. Następnie owocowa nuta od ciemnych owoców (jeżyny). Po chwili trochę paloności i lukrecja.
Pikantna nuta chilli bardzo subtelna i poczułem ją dopiero za "nastym" razem.
Po kliku niuchach przewinęła się woń prażonego słonecznika, znana bardziej ze stylu Black IPA.

Smak: Po pierwszym przełknięciu : kremowa, słodka czekolada, kawa, leśne owoce (ponownie jeżyna i czarna jagoda).
Czuć także ziarnistość i tak jak w aromacie prażony słonecznik.
Papryczki Chipotle przychodzą na samym finiszu. Są bardzo wyraźne i fajnie drapią w gardło.
Ich stężenie jest mocno zauważalne. Przez kilka miniut po każdym łyku czuć jeszcze w gardle ich obecność.
Niemniej jednak jest to tak rozkoszne doznanie, że z przyjemnością sięga się po kolejny łyk.
Na języku na dobre zadomowił się także karmel i szczypta toffi.
Goryczka ciężka do zidentyfikowania przez obecność chilli. Wydaje się dość wysoka.
Pijalność pomimo tej pikanterii zdumiewająco wysoka.

Wysycenie: Niskie.

Podsumowanie:

To piwo jest jak narkotyk. Silnie uzależnia. Dodatek pikantnych papryczek chilli Chipotle spowodował, że piwo to stało się wręcz unikatowe. Fantastyczny gęsty, oleisty wywar o najczarniejszej barwie. 
Pikantność powinna odrzucać, a ona wręcz przeciwnie - przyciąga i człowiek z chęcią sięga po każdy kolejny łyk. Balans poszczególnych składowych idealnie współgra. Doskonałe!

Molasses, black licorice, light raisiny notes, LOTS of roasty malt notes with some mild heat that leads into BIG dry espresso notes, faint ash, molasses, a little more heat, with a long, dry bitter finish. I WAS NOT expecting a beer this huge from such a small percentage. Top notch stuff. 100% repeat purchase.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 7/1/2019. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense dark brown head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, smoked pepper, caramel, toast, dark bread, light licorice/molasses/char, pine, and herbal/roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, chipotle pepper, and moderate earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, smoked pepper, caramel, toast, dark bread, light licorice/molasses/char, pine, and herbal/roasted earthiness. Moderate amount of herbal/pine bitterness and pepper spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, smoked pepper, caramel, toast, dark bread, pine, light char, and herbal/roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, chipotle pepper, and moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, moderately creamy, and lightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Some light-moderate drying bitterness and pepper spice after the finish. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. A mild amount of pepper heat builds up on the finish as you finish the glass, but never gets too strong. Overall this is an awesome pepper spiced porter style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, chipotle pepper, and moderate earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on with the balanced pepper spiciness. A highly enjoyable offering.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2014 This is the most viscous looking beer Ive had in a very long time: the pitch black liquid barely drips out the bottle! Especially in the long, moderate bitter aftertaste, the burning chilli makes this a beer you dont hurl down, this is definitely a sipper. The initial taste is moderate sweet, and this soothes the palate for a while, until the next wave of chilli attacks. Other flavours include roasted notes, coffee and liquorice, and more pronounced notes of chocolate and tobacco that I found in the flavours. I also get vague hints of leather. The mouthfeel (and throat feel!) is very rough due to the chilli, and in the beginning it was actually a bit unpleasant. Further down in the glass Im slowly getting used to the roughness. The body is full, the texture is very oily and slick, the carbonation is soft. A wonderful and intense beer, although its a bit demanding. Pours jet black with a big mocha head, looks great. Nose is oats, coffee and earthy malt. Flavour is all coffee, dark chocolate intensity up front, then comes the chilli, warming everything up. The chilli and chocolate balance is near perfect. Lovely slick, robust mouthfeel. Finish is more of that play between the chilli and chocolate. Epic.

(33 cl bottle) Black and opaque, viscous, with a medium-sized dark brown head. Looks heavy! Intense aroma of roasted malts, slightly smoky, very dark chocolate/cocoa, some licorice. But also herbs/piney notes. Warming, peppery finish. Medium to heavy bitterness, moderate sweetness. Full body, oily texture, a little sticky, soft carbonation, bitter finish. Very rich and intense.  Quite interesting.
Pitch black color with nice looking dark brown head. Aroma is roasted. Flavor is roasted, spices, chili.
Bottle. Pours black with small brown head. Chipotle and roasted aroma, chipotle taste, a little wood taste. Spicy finish.
Pours dark black with a thick creamy head. Nice robust porter with a chocolate chipotle taste. Very smooth and malty.
This has a really nice peppery finish, just enough to give a little tingle. The head is pretty much what youd expect from a porter, thick and dark brown.
Complex aroma, appealing appearance and a wonderful taste! [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

750 ml bottle.  Pours a dark brown that allows no light to pass through with a moderate brown head that lasted through the first quarter of the glass and left light lace.  Very pleasant aroma of chipotle peppers, chocolate, and roasted malt.  The flavor is similar.  The chipotle peppers do not dominate and compliment the malt quite well.  Very mild warming from the peppers.  There is a very mild smokiness in the flavor as well which I am assuming comes from the peppers.  Very smooth on the palate and well rounded.  Delicious.

Draft at Hop & Vine, Portland. Pours very dark, essentially opaque. Very slight tan head. Very little aroma, maybe a hint of chocolate. Lively mouthfeel, rich and malty, spice and chocolate rolls in at end of finish. Yeasty burn in finish as well, but not too spicy overall, add in a slight bitterness to a very complex finish and this ones a winner.

Keg at CP&K. It pours near black with a light tan head. The nose is roasted malt, light smoke, chilli, dark chocolate and earth. The taste is charcoal, tar, earth, roasted malt, light chilli spice, smoke, charcoal, toast, coffee grinds and mild acidity. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. Smooth, good depth of flavour and well balanced. Well done.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2013 En skummig käftsmäll. Smak och doft av choklad, kaffe, laktris, rökig och len. Den tillsatta rökiga jalapenosen är riktigt kraftfull och ligger kvar i gommen länge. Inget jag vill dricka mycket av men det här var väldigt välgjort och annorlunda.
Nu har jag ändrat mig, mycket mer av det här. Välbalanserat och gott på alla sätt och vis.

Keg @ CPK. The pours black with a small espresso tan head. The aromas rich roasted malts. Smooth chocolate. Mild chili, other robust spices (nutmeg, some herbs etc). The taste is wonderfully balanced sweet chocolate syrup and light chili spiciness. Subtle, not over the top. Nice ashy bitterness. Medium body. Thick, rich mouthfeel. Great vitality, quite flavorful. Overall, a cracking effort. Much better than I thought it would be.

On tap at Archive Beer Boutique. Wow what a great beer. Poured very thick and black and had a low layer of tan foam that left some good lacing on the glass. Good aroma but it is the flavour that really gives this beer the edge. Long hot afterburn from the chipotle goes on and on.

A - Dark black with a hint of brown and a finger of frothy khaki-chocolate colored head. Fades normal.

S - Sweet dark chocolate malts, chipotle, roasted coffee, black licorice, bit of molasses.

T - Sweet dark chocolate malts, bit of milk chocolate, lightly spicy chipotle peppers, roasted coffee, black licorice, molasses.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a spicy, warming, and sweet finish.

D - Nice spicy porter. The chipotle adds some nice heat without taking over.

Gitzwart met bruine kraag. Geur van koffie, cacao en hop. Smaak is extra pure chocola, koffie (gaat over in koffiebitter) en eindigend met een lange chilipeper nasmaak. Vond het interessant, maar niet fantastisch. Eerder wat onprettig door het eind.

Aldus Huubs.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with some sediment and a tan head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, and chilli. Flavour is roasted malt and a huge, delicious chilli bite.

Kaatuu IS:mäisenä (musta, tummanruskea vaahto), jättää pitsiä reunalle. Haju on paahteinen, lakritsinen, chilin polttelukin tuntuu. Maitoa ja kahviakin joukossa. Maku on vahvan poltteleva, kahvinen, maitoinen ja suklainen. Paahteisuuttakin on, mutta ennen kaikkea chiliä. Suutuntuma on melko täyteläinen ja kuumottava. Erikseen pidän chilistä ja oluesta, mutta ei ne välttämättä yhteen sovi. Kannatti kokeilla kylläkin.
Poured dark with no head. Aroma of roast malt. Medium to full body, flavour of roast coffee and a hint of chocolate. Dry aftertaste.
roasty, roasty, roasty, floral, herbs, leather, bell peper,black, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, umami, medium body, sticky, nice little heat at the end of the taste

A wonderful spicy stout. It smells like cabbage and caraway, but the taste is clearly dominated by chili pepper. Thanks to the roasted malts this beer is beautifully balanced, a spicy beer as it should be. On tap in BeerTemple (Amsterdam).

On tap at Pivni Rozmanitost. Pours potch black with lovely dark brown head. Aroma is roastiness, hops, coffee, hint of pear. Flavor is chili, malt, milk, hops, coffee. Long chili aftertaste makes it a bit unpleasant.

Pours an opaque black with a brow hat that leaves spotty lacing up the glass. Aroma of chipotle peppers, cocoa powder, dark chocolate & roasted malts. Taste is dark malts, coffee up front that turns into coffee bitterness on the end & then a burning/warming from the chipotle peppers.  Very smooth and great blend for the high amount of chipotle pepper in this beer.

Pours an opaque black colour with a couple fingers of light brown head quickly turning into a healthy ring around the glass and spotty. Aromas of chipotle pepper, chocolate. Flavours of chipotle peppers, chocolate, mocha, decent spicy balance.
black beer, no head. Aroma sweet,Very sweet. Taste is light bitter light sweetness. Chili like burning at the back of the throat. Medium body.

(draught 0,3l @ Vánoční pivní besídka Brno 2012)
Chocolate, cocoa and some weird aroma. Black color. Dark brown head. Light sweet, strong cocoa bitter taste. Finishes with chilli peppers burn.
Drunk it unde name Chipotle Porter. Dark eith small dak foam, rich taste and aroma

On tap The Rover, Göteborg. Dark Brown, almost black. Aroma of dark chocolate. Taste real spicy (chili) but still it is a stout with bitterness in the finish. Really good, but i am not sure if i can separate this one from Mikkeller Hot Rod.

Black with reddish tan head. Chocolate, oak and smokey whiskey aroma. Wonderful rich malty molasses flavor with whiskey, pepper and mocha coffee  . Finishes with wood esters. Wish I could have picked up some of the chipotle..

Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruit, and hints of chocolate. Pours a deep dark black with a mostly lasting  eautiful dark tan head and no lacing. The taste is burnt malt, hints of coffeee bitterness and a slow chipotle burn. Excellant. Medium-full body with soft carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel and a pleasing burn on the finish. Overall, this is a well crafted brew. While peppery beer are not my favorite style, this was enjoyable.

A-opaque cola brown with thin cocoa brown head.  Minimal lacing. A-coffee and toasted malts overwhelm the nose. Some pepper, salt, smoke and chalk carry to the end.  M-mild carbs with slightly watery feel for a porter. T-espresso, smoke, chalk and grains start the taste.  Lingering, potent pepper takes over and has a motivated spicy finish.  Pepper pretty much takes over the taste after initial contact, with earthy, vegetable notes clawing from underneath.

Color is thick, dark, uniform. Looks like motor oil (with this its a good thing!). Aroma is strong with coffee and unsweetened dark chocolate. Once it hits the palate is has a beautifully well-rounded smoky spiciness to it. Chipotle lingers throughout the chocolatey finish, which is fulfilling and robust while remaining smooth. Very little head, dark as night, and delicious.

From a 33cl bottle, pours deep black color with a thick drak beige head. 
Aroma of coffee and dark chocolates, hops and spices.  Flavors of coffee, dark chocolates, molases, candy, grass, hops and a kick of spicy chilis.   Wow its the most spicy beer ive had.  Maybe a bit to spicy for a beer.  its keep on kicking with spices as you drink it.  Heavy body, bitter and spicy.  But very well made.  I enjoyed this but one is enough.  Very ineteresting.

On tap @ Pingvinen, Bergen. Pours an almost perfect black, with a fingerthick creamy and coloured head. Like a proper stout should. And, what? Not a stout? But the aroma is nice burned malts, with coffee, chocolate and toffee notes. The body is nicely creamy, with a soft carbonation. And the flavour is sweet with burned malts, coffee, chocolate and Hmmm, black pepper. And chili. Yes, lots of chili, and its getting hotter and hotter throughout the finish. Someone might argue that its a bit over the top with all this perppery chili? Well maybe not your average stout, but it sure kicks hard and strong for a 6,6 ABV. Nice one.

Tap at Black Sensation, Mikkeller Bar. Opaque black with a lively light brown head, good retention and lace. Aroma is hard roasted malts with notes of licorice and what might be a whiff of chili. Taste is sweet roast with a strong licorice note, a whiff of vanilla and a nice chili bite, that gets stronger the more beer warms up. A very, very good beer.

Burned platic and toast nose with prunes. Mahogany, thin beige head. Intense toasty flavor with mulberries. Sourwood and chili pepper at midpalate. Creosote finish. Soft carbonation. Hitting on all pointsd as usual for Mikkeller. The bouquet seemed a little off but I think that was some weird cumulative effect of the very different aromas together.

750ml bottle that I scored for $7 which s good because I would not have bought it at $14. Looks like your standard porter, black with a decent head. Smells slightly like a porter but here come the chipotles, uh oh....The flavor is overwhelming, straight chipotle peppers and adobo sauce smothering the porter to death. Both me and my friend found this to be very one dimensional. It wasnt gross but it wasnt tasty either,

Pours thick and creamy. Burnt, creamy, hoppy and then....the chili kick! Works really well. A wonderful stout with flavors of chocolate and chili that really go well with each other. Excellent!
330ml bootle- lovely dark colour, with a good malt aroma. lovely sweet initial taste with a creeping death chilli burn. Wonderful beer.

Tap at Belg Aube Roppongi. Dark brown, dark golden small bubbly head. Looks dangerous and dirty.  Aroma is roasty, lots of coffee bitterness, lots of spicy chilli. Taste is nice, coffee bitter initially, spice creeps up at the end to a full on chilli taste. Slightly smoky. Long spice and smoke finish. Got a real bite to it. Exactly what I needed at this stage, a few drinks down the line. But one was definitely enough.

Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is roast, coffee, slight smoke, molasses and bready malt. Flavour is coffee, sharp pepper, roasty malt, bread, sharper pepper, faint caramel, sharper pepper > continue >>>...

Good thing I like spicy.

Bottle poured a deep black with an enormous mocha head that dissapated slowly leaving intense lacing.  Aroma includes roasted malt, smoke, and pepper.  Taste begins with coffee and roasted malt before bakers chocolate is introduced leading to a peppery finish with slight chipotle burn on the throat.  Nice mouthfeel with smokiness and relatively intense chipotle flavor/burn lingering.  Chipotle should have been better balanced (e.g., Stone 11/11/11 blending green chili).
Bottle. A little smoky, a bit more chocolately, and a lot more firey. Im not sure it comes together, but Im not complaining.
Tap. Deep brown, near black. This is amazing. Pepper is very subtle heat. Really smooth porter with huge rich malt.

Pours black with a thick brown head. Very strong aroma of chocolate and roasted malts. Great flavour. chocolate toasted barley and coffee, all slowly melding together into a very smokey cpicy finish. Fastastic.

Würzig malziger Beginn, leichte Schooladennoten. Hintergründig scharfe Noten, pfeffrig. Die Malzigkeit nimmt wenig ab, die würzigen Noten werden intensiver, die Schärfe nimmt zu. Süß-pfiffriges Finish, die Schärfebleibt gerade noch in angenehmem Rahmen, leicht brotig. 12/11/9/9/6/10

Shared this bottle with people in line at the CBS release. Poured from a 750ml into my Deschutes snifter.

A: Pours a dark brown with a nice khaki head and leaves a webbed lace down the glass.

S: Smells of green peppers, a little chocolate and a little malt bill. The pepper is dominated which I expected.

T: The taste blows the smell out of the water. A great smokiness is present first and foremost. The spice from the chipotle gives it a great kick and there is a green paper freshness that is great. There is a slight sweet chocolate on the backend that really rounds it out.

M: Refreshing and spicy, medium bodied with a nice carbonation.

O: The nose wasnt too inviting but the taste more than made up for it. Very well balanced. The best pepper beer out there.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-02-2011
Samped st an esbls tadting.  Black with a swirly tan head.  Bourbon smell with pepper and wood.  I taste peppers but it is not hot.  Soy and some vanilla with spices.  Intetesting and tasty.

On tap @ Toronado: Poured a jet dark black liquid into a snifter with a perfect layer of tiny head. The aroma is rich and succulent with bold scents of roasted malts while a soft touch of chipotle or some other kind of spicy chili pepper. The flavor is amazing with a bold taste of smoked chili pepper and or dried ancho or poblano peppers. Such a complex yet harmonic balance in this beer that it won me over thus earnings high scores across the board.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 I never bothered to read the Danish label at the supermarket, so only when I got home and slowly went through it again I realised it had chipotle. Oh, what the hell, lets try it. Interesting aroma, leathery, charred, very much of an Imperial Stout but with a certain nose of olives in oil. Green olives. Pours oily black, with one of the darkest heads I have ever seen. Walnut brown head, very thick. Flavours should make a prefect stout if not for the peppery heat. That spoils the flavour and ruins the finsih. Just too hot for a beer. This Danish concotion doesnt do much to improve the image of Texas rangers.

Pours pitch black with thick mocha head that lasts.  Smells of coffee and chocolate.  Tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, mocha, and chili pepper.  Bitter flavors mixed with pepper flavors.  Finishes spicy with a bitter and spicy linger.

Thick black pour with creamy brown head (plenty of it, and it lingers).  Aroma is rich and stouty - roasted barley, chocolate, leather.  Taste is big and bold - great stout which comes across almost as an imperial.  Sweetness cut by bitterness and through it all the heat from the chilis.  Heat from the chilis replaces the heat from alcohol in stronger stouts.  The heat is maybe a bit much in the finish (and I like heat).

Tap at the Craft Beer Co - 14/09/12.
Pitch black with a thin coffee head which soon thin and good lacing ensued.
Nose is sweet malt, chocolate, and a little woody smokiness.
Tastes of charred wood, sweet chocolate, burnt tones, chilli and a little medicinal at the end, almost whisky like.
Medium bodied, but fairly chewy, moderate carbonation, smoky finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 330ml bottle. Pitch black colour with average, frothy to creamy, lasting, lacing, brown head. Roasty, dark malty aroma with notes of leather, herbs, spice, already peppery hints of chili in the nose. Taste is intense dark malty, dry and roasty, hints of dark chocolate, lasting hot, peppery aftertaste; also a Black IPA-like hop note in the finish.

Aroma: chocolate, roasty, toast, coffee, resin, leather, 
Appearance:black, minimal head, tan foam, 
Taste:heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, chilli aftertaste
Palate: medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall: I like my stouts and porters and i love chilli so this is one ill come back to over and over

On tap at CBC, London. It pours a dark brown/almost black colour with a small light brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, raisins, figs, licorice and red wine. Taste is mostly sweet with a closing bitterness from the roasted malts. Notes of wood, coffee, smoke. FinIsh is bitter and hot. The chili peppers show themselves in the lingering hot and spicy aftertaste. Mouthfeel is quite thick with good carbonation. Overall, an outstanding chili stout, with just the perfect amount of spiciness.

330ml bottle. Roast and spicy aromas. Pours very dark, opaque, with really nice creamy dense tan head, persistent, with some good lacework. Fullbodied, soft carbonation and oily exture. Taste is really hot, chipotle dominant,  with some notes of roasted malts. Aftertaste is really long and spicy. Enjoyable if you are into spices...

Draught at work. ( I never get tired of saying that). Poured into one of our sampler tulips. Pours medium deep brown, with a black core, thin dark tan head, spotty lacing - surprisingly poor lacing for a draught sample. Nose is big chipotle, very dry and spicy pepper notes with light smoke, sweet toffee/fudge, marshmallows, hickory, and cocoa powder. Flavours of spicy coffee, very woody, like hickory or maple smoke, plus lots of smoke, fudge, and plenty of earth. Not the equal of the Speyside Edition, but then what is?

Jag har drucket en likanande öl innan, Chili från Helsingborgs bryggeri. Jag var inte alls imponerad av deras öl även om den var relativt innovativ och jag är lite osäker på huruvida jag gillar denna eller inte. Jag gillar den mörka rostade smaken och den krämiga och bastanta kroppen, men jag gillar inte känslan av chili i halsen. Om chilin hade varit försiktigare så hade ölen varit avsevärt mycket bättre.

doftar lite ketchup

Bottle. Black color with a medium-sized dark brown head. Roasted malt in the aroma with notes of chocolate, dark fruits and some spiciness. Flavor is roasted malt, chocolate, bitterness and slight smokiness. Quite dry finish and nice burning aftertaste.

Black with a thick tan head. Aroma is roasted coffee with notes of chocolate. Flavor is intense, surprised this isnt a stronger beer. Strong roasted coffee bitterness mellowed out with a sweet dark chocolate finish. Finish was fairly mild then theres just a slight pepper bite in the finish. Smokey throughout and aftertaste is rich but not cloying. Impressive beer, well worth finding.
Lots of taste and smell. An olfactory sensation like no other. The aftertaste lingers a long time and are very dry. But when you drink it first, it is sweet to the taste, but transitions to dryness.

Pours jet black with tanned head. Roasted malt and some coffee on the nose. Little sweeter taste than I was expecting with dark chocolate and quite a spicy finish that lingers. Pretty interesting beer, quite enjoyable
Bottle. Black pour, creamy tan head. Aroma is roasty, spicy BBQ sauce. Flavor is roasty and hot peppers in the finish. A little on the spicy side but still manageable. Quite nice.
What a interesting beer nice strong aroma that bites your nose,to drink very smooth with a warming after taste, and a nice bite. Its a very good porter. Spicy like a chipotle beer should be.
Bottle thanks to dallas brew scene..Pour is very dark with tan head..Nose is chipotle,spice, chocolate,spice..Taste is spice,chocolate,heat,earth,..palate is light heat

Virgen Santísima, ¡una cerveza que pica un poco! . Desprende aromas clásicos del estilo, café, cacao, también ahumado. Es muy agradable, la conjunción de aromas que desprende es compleja pero a la vez sencilla (esto suena cutre o sin sentido) En boca se percibe lo mismo y además un toque más dulce y acaramelado. Muy cremosa, beberla es muy placentero para los sentidos.

La espuma marrón es preciosa, te atrapa estéticamente aunque aquí no entremos habitualmente a valorar visualmente a las cervezas.

Nos parece una cerveza muy bien lograda, aunque puede echar para atrás a algunos por el deje picante del chile chipotle.

En cualquier caso, para nosotros es un buen trabajo y nos pareció que el añadido del chile no daba mucho el cante.

Draft at Taps Beer Bar Kuala Lumpur. The bar tender thought I might not like this beer, so he insisted I sampled it first! He didn't need to worry :-) Its really unusual to find a chilli beer, but this one was perfect. It was great to taste a spicy beer where the spiciness was from chillies and not from hops. Perhaps a little overpowering for some, but not for me. A great beer. Give it a try, perhaps with a curry!

Bottle at Strefa Piwa, Krakow. Gorgeous in goblet, looks like an impy, dense black with dark brown head. Aroma is also big, and fresh with minty hop overlay and heat. No chili in aroma but in the throat for sure. Balance is fab, dry spicy finish with a natural acidity, chocolate. Stronger than expected, earthy dense Aztec spiced melange of flavors.

Pours nice deep brown with moderate lacing. Nice smokey and maltiness on the nose.   The chipotle is overpowering for my liking. It dominates the flavour and leaves a lingering spicy aftertaste. Likely better with a meal but not or me.

Bottle shared at a cottage near Blokhus, summer 2012. Bought at Vinspecialisten Aalborg
Pours black with a brown head, very nice laces. Smells of roasted malts, coffee, hops, tar and peat. Medium sweet, quite smoky and peaty, some liquorice. After a while i get a very distinct chili pepper. Guess i found the chipotle chili... Very nice. It lasts and lasts and blends in with the hop finish which is medium bitter. Really want to try this again

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Dark brown/black with a minimal head. Aroma not as smokey as expected, dark malts and chocolate dominates. Perfect amount of chilies, the heat from the chipotle increases with every sip without taking over. For stouts I prefer a heavier body so if this would have been an imperial stout I would have appreciated it much more.

Bottle from Kris Wines, London. Poured thin and dark brown / black with a velvet-brown head that exploded with roasted coffee malt aromas. Taste was long and complex and ran through sweet cameral to bitter coffee with a spike of chipotle chili in the middle that tingled the tongue then slowly faded from the palette. Awesome beer.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2012 Looks like a thin stout when poured but the smell of this one is amazing.  You can really smell the chipotle.  Chipotle comes through in the taste and it is a little spicy.  The heat gets better and better as you sip on it which is exactly what I would want from a beer brewed with chili peppers.  Best chili pepper beer Ive had.

Pretty much black.  Into the goblet w/o much head.  Fat rich malt, lots of chocolate and dark fruits.  The palate has a stack of bitter chocolatw (not even close to Mexican) and a subtle chipotle character.  Some rounded ancho notes, lots of deep chocolatey porter stuff. I personally wod like it smokier but this is nice.

Tried @ Grain Cru - Roll Out the Barrels, Belgian Beer Café.Opaque black with a depleting tan head and minimal carbonation. Aroma has hints of dark chocolate, charred grain, way too much of  smokers lounge ash and tar and a piercing, acidic and herbal hit of green peppers. Good all encompassing mouthfeel, quite smooth and velvety. Dark chocolate is prevalent with a touch of aniseed aiding its liquorish dwell. The swallow spoils all this. Hot burn with an acidity that is actually pleasant but it is the tobacco smoke and emphysema-esque, smokers breath that is far too lingering. It is a husky, tobacco ridden, spiced choc-block overall. Not my thing. (33cL, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

20 cl tasting glass @ Mikkeller bar in Copenhagen, Denmark. Beautiful, chocolate brown pour with thin cocoa-tint head. Aroma of chocolate and heat (something is lurking in there). Almost like a paprika tingle to the nose. A fanatastic porter! Ideal temperature for imbibing . . . the beer has a velvety mouthfeel, coats the palate with a roasted, smokiness paired with the previously mentioned chocolate notes and then . . . the money shot. Boom! The pepper hits the back of the throat! I am in awe of this beer. Probably one of the most amazing beer experiences of my life. What can I say? I bought a 750 cl bottle and drank it when I got back to Sweden.
Wow Great beer. Really feel the chill in your mouth but at the same time quite refreshing. Aroma strong yet smooth.

330 ml. bottle. Black with a creamy, dense tan head. Aroma with roasted malts, dark chocolate and a hint of smoke. Taste is slightly sweet (and chili burning!) with chilli and chocolate, roasted malts. Medium body, average carbonation and an oily texture. Finishes with chocolate and a nice chilli burn. This beer literally makes me sweat of the intense chilli burn. Well made, and my best spiced up beer so far!

Shared with jimmythespoon at brewfellas.
Black color,small foam, burning taste and aftertaste. Chilly,pepper etc.

I dont like it at all. its my opinion, but i can understand that its a very interesting and nice beer for others. for me, its too much. i cant stand the burning feeling at my throat.

Grifo. Vaso de ½ Pinta. Saboreada en jun´12. Color negro coronada por espuma beige amarronado de burbuja mediana y que se disipa con lentitud. Capa cremosa. En nariz, maltas torrefactas, notas picantes, pan quemado y levadura. Sabores de maltas torrefactas dulces y café, con matices de chocolate. Sutil guindilla en el intermedio con moderado amargor. Cuerpo medio-ligero y carbonatación media. Paladar sabroso y abundante. Final intenso de granos de café torrefactos y retrogusto picante y largo. Cerveza con un sorprendente equilibrio de sabores.
On-tap. ½ Pint glass. Enjoyed on jun´12. Black color headed by brownish beige froth. Medium size bubbled, rocky, slowly dissipated crown. Roasted malts, spicy notes, burnt bread  & yeast to the nose. Sweet roasted malt & coffee flavors with chocolate hues. Subtle spicy chili & moderate bitterness in the middle. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Flavorful & plentiful palate. Intense roasted coffee grains finish & long peppery aftertaste. Amazing well balanced flavor beer.

Poured up on tap at Delirium Hoppy Loft with deep dark body with mocha colored head and sheet lacing. The aroma offers up dark roasted malts, toasted toffee, dark roasted coffee and chocolate. The taste quickly gives up dark roasted malts, burnt malts, chocolate and dark roasted coffee. Moments later it moves into growing chili pepper meat and chili pepper heat. The heat from the chili grows and grows into firm levels into the finish leaving warmth in the mouth deep into the after taste. Great looking beer with tasty execution of roastiness and chili pepper like heat.

Lite diskret kaffedoft. Smaken även den inte så stor men tydlig hetta av chilipeppar. Annars lite små rostade toner. Ganska trevlig.
