Black colour, small brown head. Aroma is sweet plum, sugar, some honey, roast and quite spicy. Flavour is roasted malts, some alcohol, spices and quite burning in the finish.

Bottle. Pours balck with a brown head. Hops and dark malts in aroma. Notes of dark chocolate. Taste is hoppy at first, then malty (coffee and chocolate). The aftertaste is quite spectacular with notes of smoke, bitter dark chocolate and some chili. The chili is quite balanced and actually a "natural" part of the brew. One of the best chili brews ive had even if its a little too much of everything for being really drinkable.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black beer with a large, creamy lightbrown head. The appearance is very nice and gets a rare 5. The aroma is roasted, coffee, licorice and smoke. The flavor is roasted, smoke, peat smoke and some warmth from the chili. The palate is roasted, coffe and chili. Overall a good beer with a good balance.

Tap at Blind Tiger. Poured a rich black. Nose is very similar to the beer geek stout. Rich malty,chocolate and coffee. Im going to guess and say that its the base beer for this. The chipolte adds a nice spice note and cimpliments well. Pretty spicy too. If you like splicy porter this one youll love.
Had this one @ CBF 2010. Black colored brew with a nice brown head. Pepper in the aroma, some coffee and chocolate. In the flavor there are chocolate malts and peppers, spicy!

Very stable, huge and very dark brown head over near black beer. Roasted coffee nose, dry hops and mole sauce, and very outspoken black cardemom peel aroma. Coffee, spiced, but the typical smoked chipotle flavour only comes out retronasal, together with a telltale heat in the throat. Well-bodied, very slick, fiery MF. Smokiness mounts all along. Certainly not bad - but... Doable as it might be on the chili matter, I had already problems finishing a glass; 75cl bottling is a silly idea, a real waste in this case.

Black with a large creamy brown head and excellent lacing. Roasted malts and coffee aroma. Flavors are acidic, sweet and bitter carrying roasted and smoked aromas with a chilli warmth to prove it! Full bodied. Oily texture with a dry finish. Very nice! Sampler @ CBF 2010.

On Tap at TAP 1, Copenhagen 07/05/2010
Big roast aroma. Dark beige head. Black rich on the palate strong in alcohol and fruity with a little dryness in a burning chilli and roast finish.

28-MAY-2010, draft @Mikkeller.
Black with brown head. That yellow hue that is sometimes seen in black beers...
Roasted, sweet and only slightly smokey.
The chili hits the throat after some seconds, and burns a little.
Very nice and very creamy porter. A very fine base porter and for once the chili works fine in a beer, and adds to the roasted flavors.

Rating #12 from danish beer festival 2010.
Black sticky look with a dark brown head. Sweet honey in the aroma along with roasted malt notes. Bitter roasted flavors with a clear chili finish. As expected which was nice.

Draught at Copenhagen Beer Festival.  Very black with beige head. Asphalt aroma.Chocolate and caramel coms first, chili heat joins later, coffee liesin the background. Sweet with fairly hard mouthfeel. The chili burn crashes with the roastiness. Not one bit pleasant Im afraid.

On tap @ CBF 2010. The aroma has pepper, coffee and a hint of iodeine/medicin. Black, oily coloured ber with an fluorescent brown head. The taste is peppery sharp with coffee and roast. Bit too sharp.
Tap @ Copenhagen 10. Dark color, big creamy brown head. Spicy peppery aroma. Soft malt, covered by way 2 much pepper. Disappointing. Some coffee aroma. In the end it still burns in my throat.

Sample at DBF 2010.
Black with a light brown head leaving some lacings. Aroma moderate malty (hard roasted, chili) and hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet and bitter/spicy. To much chile. Medium body.

From tap@Ørsted Ølbar & Cafè. Grey-shaded blond head. Body is black with brown edges.  Hard roasted malts, coffee notes and earthy hops in the aroma. A pleasant spice scent too. No chili detected in the first sip. After a few minutes the chili invade the palate.  Quite hot, yet balanced and enjoyable.  A medium strong, slight sweet malt body is there to back up, along with notes of  coffe, fruits and bitterness from the malts and the hops added. Everlasting chili finish.

pitch dark, smooth brown head.
nice roasted aroma, brown sugar, spicy chilli tinge.
flavor is mild roasted stuff, as a base for some pretty heavy chili. sort of a chili porter. The chili is good.

On tap at CPH beer festival.
Fine porter, burning chili feeling. The pepper dominates everything, this was not very pleasant!
At. CPH Beerfestival.Black colour with large beige head.Aroma is rosted and spicey of chili and pepper too spicey i guess after mine taste but o.k.Some hint of chocolate but to spicey.
Sample at Copenhagen beerfestival. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, vanilla, wood, smoke and chocolate.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2012 First ratingAt Copenhagen Beerfestival, on May 7, 2010Black color, dark brown head. Sweet, chocolate, bitter, dry taste. Dry cocoa aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Green peppers, sweet scent.7/4/8/3/15=3.7RerateDraught at Ölrepubliken on October 29, 2012During the tap take over from Mikkeller and To Øl.Black color, dark brown head. Sweet, chocolate scent. Sweet, chocolate, caramel taste. Turns to burning chili seeds on teh tongue in the aftertaste. Actually very strong chili, too strong to feel other taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.8/4/7/3/14=3.6

Draught @ Orsted Olbar, Norre Farimagsgade 13, 1364 Copenhagen, Denmark.Clear dark black color with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, roasted, burnt, coffee, iodine, smoke, moderate hoppy. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and heavy bitter with a long duration, smoked, chili - alcohol burn finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily and sticky, carbonation is soft to flat. IMO a bit tomuch chili burn, result is that the beers is not easy to drink ... [20100410]

Tap @ Ørsted Ølbar, Cph.
Pours a lovely, almost completely black. Small, frothy, brown head that stays. Aroma has chocolate, soft roasted malts, walnuts, a hint of pepper and soft liqourice. Medium carbonation, fine dry mouthfeel. Very lovely flavour, just how I like it in balance. Fat malt, light roasted, dark chocolate abound, some coffee. Then lots of creeping, soft chili hotness. Long, lingering, dry, roasted, chocolate and hot finish. Lovely.

Bottle at home.
Pitch black coloured with a huge brown head.
Roasted aroma of dark chocolate, chili pepper and coffee.
Roasted flavour of dark chocolate, chili pepper and coffee.
Roasted and burning finish of coffee and chili pepper.
Nice beer, but too much pepper.
Black with a big and lasting light brown head. Aroma of malt, licorice, smoke and chili. Sweet and roasted flavour with a hot spicy finish. A bit too much for me.

Pours black with a large brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, smoke, coffee and chilli. Flavour is roasted malt, malt acidic, alcohol, cold coffee and chilli. I dont like the chilli in this beer, it is a bit overpowering.

Fløska. Pitch black colour with a huge nice brown creamy head leaving a good thick lacing. Very pleasant aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and some Chipotle. Good mouthfeel indeed. Lovely bit sweet soft flavour of well roasted malt, chocolate, some dark fruit, light smoke, pleasant tingeling spicy chiliness from the tasteful meaty medium spiced Chipotle (this chili pepper is a ripened jalapeño dried by smoking). Roasted malt, chocolate, mild smoke, Chipotle spiced pleasant finish.  The more smoked and costful version, Chipotle Ahumado, would in my opinion be even greater compared to a Chipotle Morita. Chipotle Ahumado would be ideal in an Imperial Stout! :-)

Bottle @ Odense Tasting, April 2010. Pours pitch black with a creamy head and lacings. Nose is roast, coffee and smoke. Velvetly smooth flavor and palate. Hard roasted coffee, chili and chocolate. Warm and quite hot bite. Very well made!

On tap at Ørsted Ølbar. Pitch black with a small tan head. Roasty and fruity aroma with coffee and chocolate notes. The flavour is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and the comes the chili. It overpowers the tasting notes after 5 or 6 sips. Creamy texture.

Playing around with chilli is apparently very popular - A certain danish beer even won a title using that spicy stuff. Its not the first time Mikkeller have used chilli and the last time was pretty good bodes well for this next chilli-shot from Mikkeller. The bottle is  a thick and heavy 75cl bottle with some need lable work on. If a beer ever has been black this is the one. Hell is murky as MacBeth said. The head is triumphant huge and dark brown. This is a black beauty. The nose is roasty and your clearly sense the chili. It has a smokyness than reminds me of my favorite spice - bacon toped with burned malts. The taste is a three step thing. At first the sweetness from roastet malts along with som vanilla and licorice. The there is some hoppy bitterness at finally your are hit by a balanced afterburn from the chillis. You rarely see a beer with a balanced chili - but this one has succeed in blending the taste of chili in so it  adds to the picture instead of taking it all over. Nice. The palate is pretty thick and oily taking in mind that its a rather mild beer alcoholvice. Good job.

Bottled. A pitch black beer with a huge very dark brown head. The aroma has strong notes of brettanyces, chocolate, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, straw, and wood, leading to a dry finish.

75 cL bottle. Pours pitch black with a huge and chocolate brown head. Aroma is hoppy fruity and slight spiced. Smooth roasted and dark chocolate malt flavoured. Slow and distinct chipotle chili bite. Lingering fruity and chocolate flavoured into the far finish. Building chipotle bite.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of Ungstrup. Pours completely opaque black with a dense light brown head leaving some laces. Aroma of hard roasted malt with a whiff of chili. Solid body, hard roasted malt and vanilla with quite some chili bite. The hot chili grows the further you dig into this. 010410

Bottled. Pitch black coloured. Dense brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roast, grass, light smoke, light liqourice. Flavour of chocolate, roast, brown sugar, chocolate, smoke. Medium to full bodied. Roasty bitterness with a fantastic touch of the chili in the end. Black beers and chili goes well together. Very nice.

Bottle, 7.7% abv, shared with Skinnyviking just after we had club together for a bottle at Ølbutikken. Pitch black body. Dense, dark brown head. Chilli to the nose alongside aroma of sweet malts. Blend of chilli and chocolate in flavour supported by hints coffee and dark fruits. Lingering aftertaste with chilli on the swallow. Stands out as a powerful drink (Copenhagen, 27.03.2010).
Black with a medium beige head. Aroma had chili, burned malt, dark chocolate and pepper. Flavour had burned malt, dark chocolate, chili, espresso and pepper. Finished with a good chili burn.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting light brown head. Pitch black body. Sweet creamy chilli hops choccolate aroma. Dried fruit chilli coffee choccolate flavor. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste. Good balance between chilli and choccolate.
75cl, at 7.7%Vol, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2010, with chili peppers, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex Porter, spicy, yet balanced, hazy, rocky head, good brew, original brew!

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2011 Bottle at Morten & Heidis - Shared with Morten & Mette (Heidi didnt like it). Pitch black - brown head. Burned, high burned, sharpness, light chili taste, peppery, smokey, nice smokey, chocolate, medium hoppy, vegetable hoppy, thick body. Chili burning finish - too much for me.............Re_Rate: New version is a bit more smokey and less chili burning... lovely !!!
